ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Design_view_terminal_component_shape_relationship is the association between the following pairs where the individual relationship is a (source,target) pair: (, ), (, ), (, ).
This relationship positions and orients the geometric model of the source into the model of the target using an item defined transformation that uses two placements, one in the source and one in the target to define the transformation. The target is the geometric model of a component in an assembly and is not the geometric model of the component in a library (although it may be a copy) and is not the geometric model of the assembly. Therefore the transformation is local to the component geometric model. An shall not be associated with a . An shall not be associated with a . A
shall only be associated with a .

specifies the
that is the target for the Design_view_terminal_component_shape_relationship.

specifies the
that is the source shape for the Design_view_terminal_component_shape_relationship.
specifies either the , or the , or the that is the source item for the Design_view_terminal_component_shape_relationship.
specifies the , that is the shape of the component in the design geometric model.

specifies the
that is the source placement for the Design_view_terminal_component_shape_relationship.

ext_description.p:
An Interconnect_module_component is a type of
and a type of .
ext_description.example:
Here Figure 1 illustrates a detail of an assembly drawing that shows the
in relation to a cross-sectional view of the . Figure 2 illustrates a complete assembly showing multiple .

figure.title: Part design view with an interconnect module component

ext_description.note: The Interconnect_module_component can be, for example, a circuit board in an assembly. Alternatively, it could be the substrate for a multi-chip module. This entity is included specifically so that the assembly design definition can be queried directly to determine which component in the assembly is the substrate. The Interconnect_module_component is likely the target of connectivity requirement information as allocated to various components. An Interconnect_module_component does not include all the internal details of the design of the .

An
may be assembled onto an
in the realization of an . An
may be an occurrence of an . An
may be an occurrence of an . For the purposes of this model, the current interpretation is to treat an embedded discrete component as a . The that mates with the
of the embedded component is not visible when the is assembled, but the
is still logically the interface to the
for the embedded component.

A discrete component that is installed or embedded during part of the sequential manufacturing process for an interconnect product is considered to be an
since the form of the component is not realized during the sequential manufacturing process.
A occurrence is not permitted in an assembly definition.

An
may be a floor-planning symbol if the definition is an
or an . If the
is used in this manner, then the actual components will be included in the design in a later iteration that results from including the detailed components from the
or
using a computer processor. The processor may choose to support traceability by using the
to specify what component of the
or
corresponds to the component in the design.

Planned parameters may be assigned to
by the parameter assignment to
by the
object through the
or may be assigned directly.

Requirements may be assigned to
by the requirement assignment to
by the
or may be assigned directly.

ext_description.p:
specifies the role of the
for the Interconnect_module_component.
ext_description.note: The derived_from specifies the definitions of the terminals and other interface elements of the .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The
shall not be populated.

ext_description.p:
An Interconnect_component_join_terminal is a type of
that represents some aspect of a generic
participating in a connection for an assembly. The Interconnect_component_join_terminal is defined in-situ.
ext_description.example: An example of an Interconnect_component_join_terminal is a portion of a mechanical conductive fastener that attaches a flexible wire lead to the pcb. The portion that is the Interconnect_component_join_terminal is the portion that is directly connected to the pcb.
A plain wire is considered to be an interconnect component.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the role of the
for the Interconnect_component_join_terminal.

specifies the role of the
for the Interconnect_component_join_terminal. There may be one for the Interconnect_component_join_terminal. The value of this attribute need not be specified. If the source system contains the data, then the data shall be provided.

The
shall not be populated.
If the definition is provided, it shall not be a part terminal.

ext_description.p:
An Interconnect_component_interface_terminal is a type of
that represents some aspect of a generic
participate in a connection for an assembly. The Interconnect_component_interface_terminal is defined in-situ. There is no
associated with it.
ext_description.example: An example of an Interconnect_component_interface_terminal is a portion of a mechanical conductive fastener that attaches a flexible wire lead to the pcb. The portion that is the Interconnect_component_interface_terminal is the portion that is not attached to the pcb but is attached to the wire lead.
A plain wire is considered to be an interconnect component. The Interconnect_component_interface_terminal is located at the opposite end of the wire from that defined for the same wire in .

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the role of the
for the Interconnect_component_interface_terminal. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

The
shall not be populated.

ext_description.p:
An Interconnect_module_component_terminal is a type of . A member of Interconnect_module_component_terminal may be referenced by a member of
to describe the partial or complete implementation of a connection defined as a requirement by a member of .
ext_description.example: Figure 3 illustrates the relationship between an Interconnect_module_component_terminal and its mating feature in an assembly.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the role of the
for the Interconnect_module_component_terminal.

specifies the role of the
for the Interconnect_module_component_terminal.

The
shall not be populated.

ext_description.p:
An Interconnect_module_component_surface_feature is a type of . An Interconnect_module_component_surface_feature is a surface or a segment of the edge of the
identified for assembly purposes. The definition attribute inherited from
shall specify a type of . The
attribute inherited from
shall specify a member of . An Interconnect_module_component_surface_feature may also be an , but shall not be any other type of .
ext_description.note: The entire primary or secondary surface of the may be considered to be a feature in this usage.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the role of the
for the Interconnect_module_component_surface_feature.

The
shall not be populated.
A Layered_assembly_panel_design_view is a type of .

ext_description.p: A Layered_assembly_module_design_view is a type of . A Layered_assembly_module_design_view describes a printed circuit assembly. A printed circuit assembly is nearly a synonym for printed wiring assembly, except that a printed circuit assembly may include printed components in its printed circuit board and a printed wiring assembly is constructed upon a printed wiring board that is totally interconnect without printed components. Another synonym for printed circuit assembly is circuit card assembly.

example.p: See figure 4 for an illustration of a Layered_assembly_module_design_view.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the , as seen from the context of its next assembly, for the Layered_assembly_module_design_view.

ext_description.p: An Assembly_connection_zone_position_relationship is the association between a geometric model of an , as a target, and a geometric model of a , as the source. This relationship positions and orients the source into the target using a transformation. The source is a model of a connection area associated with a design specific terminal created in the assembly.
ext_description.note:
There can be only one terminal that uses the
referenced so there is no need to reference the terminal in this relationship.

The terminal that uses the
is a terminal of a component in the assembly.

ext_description.p:
specifies the role of the
for the Assembly_connection_zone_position_relationship.

for the Assembly_connection_zone_position_relationship.

for the Assembly_connection_zone_position_relationship.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Bare_die_component is a type of
and a type of
that is defined by a .

specifies the role of the
for the Bare_die_component.

The
shall not be populated.

A Bare_die_component_terminal is a type of
that is an instance of a . The Bare_die_component_terminal is the area on the bare die instance onto which an enterprise will place bond wires, thereby joining the active areas on the die instance to the next level of assembly. It is not necessarily the shape of the land itself on the die.

specifies the
to which the Bare_die_component_terminal provides electrical access.

specifies the role of the
for the Bare_die_component_terminal.

The
shall not be populated.

A Component_overlap_relationship is the relationship between one component and another in their next assembly, with respect to the physical overlap between them. This overlap is often derived from the mechanism requirements of the factory equipment that assembles the components to their next assembly. The sequence of assembly is established by the previously_placed_component and the current_component, in turn, and the minimum clearance between the two components is taken into consideration during assembly.

specifies the
of the distance between the current_component and the previously_placed_component for the Component_overlap_relationship.
specifies the , of the component to be placed next, for the Component_overlap_relationship.
specifies the , of the component previously placed, for the Component_overlap_relationship.

A Layered_assembly_module_terminal is a type of
that is part of the interface between the
and its next higher assembly.

specifies the role of the
for the Layered_assembly_module_terminal.

ext_description.p:
A Layered_assembly_module_usage_view is a type of . A Layered_assembly_module_usage_view provides the information needed to include the
in the design of the next higher level assembly, but not necessarily sufficient information to reproduce that .
ext_description.note:
A
may be located in a usage view in addition to terminals.
ext_description.example: Figure 2 illustrates details available in a usage view for a . The information available in the usage view specifically is separate from that in the design view and the relationships between the two views are usually controlled by a design organization.

ext_description.p:
specifies the largest
in the negative direction from an externally defined datum. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.example: An example of the maximum_negative_component_height attribute is for a printed circuit assembly with through-hole components, where the maximum lead protrusion dimension is given. That dimension is the maximum_negative_component_height. Another example of the maximum_negative_component_height attribute is for a printed circuit assembly with surface mounted components on both sides. The maximum_negative_component_height attribute is for the distance between the established datum and the maximum material condition of the vertical dimension of the highest surface mount component on the secondary side of the printed circuit assembly.

ext_description.p:
specifies the largest
in the positive direction from an externally defined datum. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.example: An example of the maximum_positive_component_height attribute is for a printed circuit assembly where the maximum component height in the positive direction relative to a datum is given. This dimension pertains to the fit of the printed circuit assembly in its next assembly. That dimension is the maximum_positive_component_height.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The orientation vector direction shall be considered to be positive when it is parallel to the normal of the top side of the interconnect substrate instance.

The direction from the for the
shall be negative in the Z axis direction.

The direction from the
for the
shall be positive in the Z axis direction.

A Movable_packaged_component_join_terminal is a type of . A Movable_packaged_component_join_terminal is one termination for a . The terminal provides access to the electrical functionality of the packaged_part being terminated.

specifies the role of the
for the Movable_packaged_component_join_terminal. The
need not be provided.

referred by
inherited from
shall be a .

A Routed_interconnect_component is a type of . The functionality of a Routed_interconnect_component shall be that of a short. The domain of the short depends on the material properties of the Routed_interconnect_component.

example.p: A wire or a jumper or a continuously deposited conductive paste that is included in the design may be represented as a Routed_interconnect_component.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the role of the
for the Routed_interconnect_component.

The
shall not be populated.

ext_description.p:
A Routed_physical_component is a type of
whose shape is design specific and is routed along a path described by a centreline.

example.p: A continuously deposited paste that is included in the design may be represented as a Routed_physical_component.

ext_description.p:
specifies a role of the
for the Routed_physical_component.
